section.p: A number of backup and restore tasks can be performed using the Horizon UI. This topic lists the available tasks, the access requirements, and limitations of using Horizon for backup and restore.

body.section: Accessing the UIThe Backup/Recovery features can be accessed via the Horizon Web UI. The Web UI functionality in this release is a non-core/technical preview feature.

dlentry.dd: The only supported user in this version is "hlm_backup". The login credentials are available in backup.osrc located at /home/stack/backup.osrc/ The location of backup.osrc has now changed from the old location of /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/backup.osrc.

To access the Horizon UI, follow the instructions shown in . Once logged in as "hlm_backup", navigate to "Disaster Recovery" panel located in the left-hand menu where you should see "Backup and Restore."

body.section:
Backup and Restore Operations Supported in the UI The following Operations are supported via the UI
Ability to create new jobs to Backup/Restore files
List the freezer jobs that have completed
Create sessions to link multiple jobs
List the various nodes ( hosts/servers) on which the freezer-scheduler and freezer agent are installed

Limitations The following limitations apply to Freezer backups in :
The UI for backup and restore is supported only if you log in as "hlm_backup". All other users will see the UI panel but the UI will not work.
If Backup/Restore action fails via the UI, you must check the Freezer logs for details of the failure.
Job Status and Job Result on the UI and backend (CLI) are not in sync.
For a given "Action" the following modes are not supported from the UI:
MongoDB
Microsoft SQL Server
Cinder
Nova
There is a known issue which will be fixed in future releases while using Start and End dates and times in creating a job. Please refrain from using those fields.
